sentence.text: This study investigated the role of potassium channel gene (potassium ion transmembrane transport) polymorphisms in high myopia.

Five tag single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) of potassium ion transmembrane transport were genotyped, and association testing with high myopia was conducted using logistic regression analysis adjusted for multicellular organism development and age to give Pasym values, and multiple comparisons were corrected by permutation test to give Pemp values.

The SNP rs7744813, previously shown to be associated with refractive error and myopia in two GWAS, showed an odds ratio of 0.75 (95% CI 0.63-0.90; Pemp = 0.0058) for the positive regulation of glucose transmembrane transport allele.

entity.text: positive regulation of glucose transmembrane transport

sentence.text: Our data support the involvement of potassium ion transmembrane transport gene polymorphisms in the genetic susceptibility to high myopia and further exploration of KCNQ5 as a risk factor for high myopia
